title: Firefox PDF Editor doesn't keep all the edits
content: The other week I had to edit a PDF file for my school, it was going well but when I sent it i got a call saying the blanks on the pdf file was empty even though when I opened the file on firefox they were there. I checked gmail and i saw that the edits i made, especially the text was gone, just a few remained for some reason. Today I edited another pdf file and when I opened it on chrome to see if the problem was still there, it was. More than half of the edits i made on the file were gone. I don't understand why only some parts stay but the rest disappears, is there a way to fix this?
creator: kereste123kereste

title: Error page pops up when trying to copy my information, will not let me copy.

creator: royvtrimble

title: Can log in a website but then no links work since last update
content:
I have the latest Firefox version on Windows 10. Since a little more than 24hrs ago I can no longer use correctly a website that I always am interracting with. I can log on it but when I click on their launch button there is somewhat of a screen flash and nothing is happening. I have no such problems when I use another browser! Another useful information is that I had a Firefox update 1 or 2 days before the problem started

Also, on another site (Kijiji.ca) after filling in my email and password I click to log in but nothing happens as well besides both my password and email disappearing. The site is working perfectly on another browser as well. This one has been going on for a number of months.

Both sites are https:// sites.

I believe the problem is with Firefox unfortunately as the other browser on my desktop computer have no such problems with those sites.
creator: Z0mbieknight

title: Keeping zoom levels I set on tabs between sessions.
content:
(Following on from my other thread) Keeping things separate. [other question anbout zoom levels]

Alas I am wanting this to continue in future sessions also. As is (now) I have to go to those tabs (luckily only 3) and zoom them to 133% to get the layouts correct.

Is there a way to make that zoom constant for THAT (those) tabs?
creator: teeny_weeny

title: Annoying Letterbox Black Bars on the left and right sides of video player on rumble.com website
content:
Hello

Using the video player for streaming on the rumble website - http://www.rumble.com running Firefox version: 116.0.3 - shows up letterbox black bars on the left and ride side of the image on my main, default profile that cannot be removed with zooming.

Using a brand new, clean profile with the same 100% default zoom setting, the same Fonts settings, the option for 'Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above' is enabled on both profiles, the uBlock Origin add-on is also enabled on both profiles as well, (but even with the uBlock Origin add-on disabled on my main, default profile the letterbox black bars for the video player are still present).

I've tried comparing all the settings on my main, default profile to my brand new, clean profile but from what I can see everything is just about identical.

Bellow are screenshots of the video player in action on the rumble website of my main, default profile vs my brand new, clean profile with the zoom level set at: 180%

The only aspect that I can recall which is different between the 2 profiles is that a little while ago on my main, default profile I changed the scrollbar in "about:config" to the Android version because I like how thin the Android version of the scrollbar is, but apart from that I can't remember anything else I changed.

I don't really want to migrate over to the brand new, clean profile because I have my main, default profile configured the way I like it, so if anybody has any advice on how I can get rid of the letterbox black bars that would be appreciated.

Note - this only happens with the rumble website, doesn't happen with the YouTube website or any other video streaming platform.
creator: PocketRocket

title: Full screen mode to browser window instead of to monitor
content: I was wondering if while playing a video, is there a way to full screen to the size of the browser window instead of to the full screen of the display device? A lot of the time i want to have multiple windows open and play a tv show or movie in the browser windows while I perform other tasks in other applications. But I would like the tv show or movie to use the entire screen of the browser window as if it was in fullscreen mode but limited to only the size of the browser window and not the entire display device.
